AtPier_02.synopsis: Gruff duergar guard standing watch ovre the entrance to Ketheric City.
AtPier_02.how_to_trigger: To trigger Greetings (HasMet)1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Use bebug book > Location > Act 1 > UND > Duergar Camp4. Finish first dialog.5, Talk to Cleric Morghal.To trigger Nere Killed1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Use bebug book > Location > Act 1 > UND > Duergar Camp4. Finish first dialog.5, Use Recon command: "SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_TheDrowNere_State_Dead"6. Talk with Cleric MorghalTo trigger Mutiny happened1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Use bebug book > Location > Act 1 > UND > Duergar Camp4. Finish first dialog.5, Use Recon command: "SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_DuergarCamp_State_Mutiny"6. Talk with Cleric MorghalTo trigger Greeting (Deepgnome tag)1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Use bebug book > Location > Act 1 > UND > Duergar Camp4. Finish first dialog.5, Use Recon command: "addTag DEEPGNOME:2bbc3217-3d8c-46e6-b599-a0f1c9063f9a"6. Talk with Cleric Morghal.

AtPier_01.synopsis: Duergar guarding the lakeside enterance to Ketheric City. Extra mean to deep gnomes.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Both sessions take place at or near the entrance of Ketheric City and involve duergar guards, but their flavor and trigger conditions suggest different states of the same location. 'AtPier_01' is a more basic encounter with a duergar guarding the lakeside entrance. 'AtPier_02' is a more advanced encounter that can occur only after initial interactions—in particular, after finishing a first dialog at the Duergar Camp and then speaking with Cleric Morghal. Moreover, the different trigger commands (for example, setting flags like HasMet, Nere Killed, Mutiny happened, or adding a Deepgnome tag) indicate that 'AtPier_02' represents alternative, state‐dependent dialog variants. In any given playthrough, you would experience one state of the pier – either the initial state (AtPier_01) or the appropriate state (AtPier_02) once the conditions are met. This implies a natural ordering where the initial encounter (AtPier_01) happens first if it isn’t replaced and later, after completing required actions at Duergar Camp, the game state shifts to use AtPier_02. Thus, there is an ordering relation (AtPier_01 before AtPier_02) and they are mutually exclusive in a single path of play.

AtPier_02_3.speaker: Morghal
AtPier_02_3.text: Get moving, or I'll move you.

AtPier_02_4.speaker: Morghal
AtPier_02_4.text: You got grit, I'll give you that much.

AtPier_01_0.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
AtPier_01_0.text: Got my eye on you, gnome.

AtPier_01_4.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
AtPier_01_4.context: NodeContext: Gruff admonition to keep it moving.
